chapter_title: Transport of Dangerous Goods by Air

questions.question: With regard to the transportation of dangerous goods by air, operators are required to comply with:
options: the United Nations' embargo on the transportation of hazardous materials
the manufacturer's specification for the storage of items with low flash points
the Health and Safety requirements of the World Health Organization
questions.solution: the Health and Safety requirements of the World Health Organization

questions.question: Dangerous goods are defined as:
options: articles or substances which are capable of significant risk to health, safety or property
any item which contains toxic liquids or solids.
any item which has the capability to be used for purposes other than that intended.
guns, ammunition, explosives, toxic waste, or chemical, biological or nuclear agents or reagents.
questions.solution: articles or substances which are capable of significant risk to health, safety or property

questions.question: With regard to dangerous goods, what does a UN number identify?
options: The international code for the country of destination.
A substance or particular group of substances.
The identity of the registered carrier of dangerous goods.
questions.solution: A substance or particular group of substances.

questions.question: The document that identifies the technical instructions for the classification and safe transport of dangerous goods by air is called:
options: ICAO Annex 19 (Carriage of Dangerous Goods by Air).

questions.question: Certain items, which by their nature are dangerous goods, may be carried in aeroplanes excluded from the provisions. Which of the following lists correctly identifies such items?
options: Veterinary aids or humane killers, ammunition, gas cylinders, catering supplies, personal items.
Veterinary aids or humane killers, ammunition, equipment with wet cell batteries, catering supplies, personal items.
Veterinary aids or humane killers, drugs, equipment with batteries, gas cylinders, catering supplies, personal items.
Veterinary aids or humane killers, items required for operational reasons, medical aids for a patient, catering supplies, personal items.
questions.solution: Veterinary aids or humane killers, items required for operational reasons, medical aids for a patient, catering supplies, personal items.

What is the purpose of the 'acceptance checklist'?
options: To ensure that the requirements of the Technical Instructions are complied with.
To enable the loading supervisor to take appropriate precautions.
To enable performance calculations to be made with regard to total cargo weight.
To ensure that the shipper is not trying to smuggle munitions of war.
questions.solution: To ensure that the requirements of the Technical Instructions are complied with.

questions.question: Can dangerous goods be carried in the passenger cabin or on the flight deck?
options: Yes, but only goods specified in the Technical Instructions.
Yes, if authorized by the Authority.
questions.solution: Yes, but only goods specified in the Technical Instructions.
